1.0	Executive Summary

Rinchem Company, LLC certifies to the best of the signer's knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.

1.1.	The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Rinchem Company LLC., Marlborough, MA Facility.

Rinchem Company, LLC. (Rinchem) is committed to being a responsible member of the community in which it operates by giving top priority to operating in a safe and environmentally sound manner. Policy dictates that Rinchem personnel continuously identify methods to reduce the risk of handling hazardous materials and to reduce the risk to the community and environment through implementation of new technology and procedures. This commitment to safe and environmentally sound operations is documented in the Team Member Handbook, and the mission statement, which are available to all employees. The Safety and Health policy states:
SAFETY FIRST is more than a slogan at Rinchem...it is a way of life. Rinchem Company, Inc., is committed to providing a safe working environment for its staff members, its customers and the public, and maintains that: 
"NO JOB IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF OUR STAFF MEMBERS, OUR COMMUNITIES, AND THE ENVIRONMENT". 
We recognize that the responsibilities for safety and health are shared: Management, in particular the Director of Quality & ES&H, accepts the responsibility for leadership of the safety and health program, for its effectiveness and improvement, and for providing the safeguards required to ensure safe conditions. Managers and supervisors are responsible for ensuring processes are documented which reinforce safety as well as the use of engineering controls as the preferred method of promoting safety and eliminating unsafe conditions. 
Staff members are responsible for cooperation with all aspects of the safety and health program including compliance with all rules, documented procedures, a

nd regulations and for continuously practicing safety while performing their duties. Staff members are responsible for stopping activities that may lead to injuries to themselves or others. Staff members, being the most familiar with actual operations, are responsible to document suggestions for continual improvements. Each employee is granted the authority to stop work if it is deemed unsafe. The job will not be continued until the work methods are evaluated and changed, if necessary, to make the work area safe. 
Management continues to do all it can to protect the Health and Safety of all staff and to provide a safe working environment. However, safety requires the participation of everyone...only you can make safety a reality. Be alert for conditions which appear unsafe. Report unsafe conditions immediately.Report any accident, "near miss", exposure, incident, spill, or release.

1.2.	Description of the Marlborough, MA Facility and Regulated Substances Handled.

The Marlborough, MA facility is located at 111 Hayes Memorial Drive, Marlboro, MA 01752.  The facility provides transportation and public warehousing services for manufacturers, distributors and end users of pre-packaged specialty chemicals. Warehousing activities include shipping, receiving and storage of chemicals as specified by customer requirements. Toxic regulated substances are stored at the Marlborough, MA warehouse which include the RMP regulated substances arsine, boron trifluoride, chlorine, ammonia ?20% (as ammonium hydroxide 29%), hydrochloric acid ?37% and toluene-2,4-diisocyanate. Rinchem receives arsine, boron trifluoride, chlorine, ammonia ?20% (as ammonium hydroxide 29%), hydrochloric acid ?37% and toluene-2,4-diisocyanate  by truck as shipped from the manufacturer or distributor. It is unloaded from the truck using a forklift and staged for inspection. After the product passes an initial quality and safety inspection, it is received and tracked in an electronic inventory management syst

em. The hazard classification of each product is programmed into inventory management system which directs the product to be placed into the hazard-specific storage location until it is shipped to the end user. After an order is received, the product is picked and staged for a pre-shipment quality and safety inspection. Once the material passes inspection, it is loaded on to a truck using a forklift for shipment the end user. 

1.3.	The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps.
 
Rinchem management realizes that implementation of appropriate administrative and technological safeguards ensure the safety of the workers and the continued safety of public receptors. Those recommendations that are planned for implementation will be discussed in "Planned Changes to Improve Safety". The safeguards include both administrative and technological safeguards that prevent, detect, or mitigate releases of arsine, boron trifluoride, chlorine, ammonia ?20% (as ammonium hydroxide 29%), hydrochloric acid ?37% and toluene-2,4-diisocyanate. 
	
1.4.	The Five Year Accident History

There has never been a reportable accident involving arsine, boron trifluoride, chlorine, ammonia ?20% (as ammonium hydroxide 29%), hydrochloric acid ?37% and toluene-2,4-diisocyanate or any other chemical at the Rinchem Marlborough, MA warehouse. 

1.5.	The Emergency Response Program

Overall safety at the Rinchem Company, LLC, Marlborough, MA warehouse is governed not only by our ability to prevent accidental releases of arsine, boron trifluoride, chlorine, ammonia ?20% (as ammonium hydroxide 29%), hydrochloric acid ?37% and toluene-2,4-diisocyanate from occurring, but also by the ability to mitigate any accidental releases of the above mentioned material. The Rinchem Marlborough, MA warehouse is a non-responding facility and utilizes contracted third-party services for spill response and cleanup. Rinchem employees may respond to releases of these chemicals by cont

aining the spill when it can be done safely. The Marlborough warehouse Emergency Action Program consists of a Business Continuity
Plan and facility specific Emergency Action Plan. The Emergency Action Program outlines the instructions and required information in order to notify emergency responders to fire,  chemical spills, natural disasters, and other emergencies that may arise. The Emergency Action Plan and related notification documents are reviewed at least annually and revised as necessary to reflect changes that may occur to content and structure of the plan.
Notification exercises:
In response to the requirements set forth in 40 CFR 68.96(a), Rinchem has developed 
procedures to conduct an exercise of the stationary source's emergency response notification mechanisms. As all Rinchem Company, LLC facilities are nonresponding stationary sources, Rinchem management and EHS recognize the importance of communication to emergency
response organizations of the hazards that are present at Rinchem facilities. Rinchem has, and will continue to send community outreach letters to emergency response organizations (LEPC, Fire and Police) and invite these organizations to tour our stationary sources and participate in accidental release drills.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

The facility evaluates, resolves, and implements employee suggestions and recommendations resulting from routine hazard reviews, audits, process hazard analyses, and incident
investigations. Changes may be made to improve safety based on comments and information developed within ourorganization and the industry. Rinchem is always looking at ways to minimize risk through process improvement, upgrades to equipment used in the process, and review of operating procedures.
